intro: Blyttia, commonly known as the common yellow toadflax, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Blyttia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows. It is also known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, making it both a resilient and sometimes invasive species.
